Name: Patients
Notes: You, me, everybody who goes to a doctor and pays out of pocket or premiums.

Name: Taxpayers
Notes: All sources of taxes.

Name: Patient Services
Notes: A catchall for different medical services provided to patients.

Name: Physician and Clinical Services
Notes: This includes outpatient clinics, urgent care, private practices, government clinics, and medical laboratories.

Name: Retail Pharmacy Purchases
Notes: Purchases of prescription drugs by patients. This includes purchases through online pharmacies, stand-alone pharmacies, and grocery stores and big box stores that offer pharmacy services.

Name: Public insurance overhead
Notes: The operational costs of public insurance such as Medicare and Medicaid. About 8% of payments for Medicare.

Name: Private insurance overhead
Notes: The operational costs of private insurance. About 10% of payments.

Name: Nursing & Continuing Care Facilities
Notes: Covers nursing and rehabilitative services provided in freestanding nursing home facilities. These services are generally provided for an extended period of time by registered or licensed practical nurses and other staff.

Name: Other Health Res. Care
Notes: Includes Medicaid home and community based waivers, residential care facilities, ambulance services, school health and worksite health care.

Name: Home Health
Notes: Includes care provided in the home by freestanding home health agencies (HHAs).

Name: Medical Products
Notes: Covers retail sales of both durable and non-durable medical products such as non-prescription drugs, hearing aids, and wheelchairs.

Name: Other Prof. Services
Notes: Includes services provided by private-duty nurses,chiropractors, podiatrists, optometrists, and physical, occupational and speech therapists, among others. We estimate the breakdown of these expenses as similar to outpatient services.

Name: VA, DOD, CHIP
Notes: Publicly funded programs by Veterans Affairs, Department of Defense, and Children's Health Insurance Program.

Name: Other programs & 3rd parties
Notes: Includes work site health care, other private revenues, Indian Health Service, workers’ compensation, general assistance, maternal andchild health, vocational rehabilitation, Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration, school health, and other federal and state and local programs.

Name: Public Health
Notes: Covers government run public health campaigns, CDC and FDA

Name: Structures & Equipment
Notes: Capital investments in buildings and other structures as well more costly medical equipment.

Name: Private funding
Notes: Private foundations and grants funding research and other investments.

Name: Profit
Notes: This category intends to capture all profit, both by private owners and shareholders. For non-profit entities, this represents the profit margin that may be re-invested into the system for growth.

Name: Admin. & Non-health staff
Notes: This category depends on the context, but is intended to capture administrative, managerial, operational, professional, and other support staff that do not directly provide medical care.

Name: Doctors
Notes: Includes all doctors: physicians, surgeons, dentists, chiropractors, etc.

Name: Facilities & Infrastructure
Notes: Includes maintenance, rent,and facility support staff, as well as utilities and Information Technology costs.

Name: Financial
Notes: Debt, amortization costs, fees, taxes, and insurance.

Name: Medical supplies & equipment
Notes: OTC medication, durable & non-durable equipment, devices, and supplies

Name: Pharmacy Benefit Manager
Notes: Examples include Express Scripts, CVS Caremark, and OptumRX. Note that many of these share parent companies with retail pharmacies.

Name: Retail Pharmacy
Notes: Businesses such as CVS Pharmacy, Walgreens, Walmart, Amazon Pharmacy, and Express Scripts.

Name: Drug Manufancturer
Notes: Companies such as J&J, Novartis, and Pfizer.

Name: Production
Notes: pharma and other products
